Cloud-filling techniques

Use spatio-temporal data to fill the gaps produced by clouds.

Satellite images smoothing

Correct small distortions or extreme values produced atmosferic effects

Downscaling procedures

Improve satellite images resolution for spatio-temporal analysis of small areas or regions.

Unai Pérez-Goya, PhD student

Graduated in Computer Engineering from the University of Mondragon (Spain) in 2012, and Master in Innovation and Research in Computer Science with a specialization in Distributed Systems from the Polytechnic University of Catalonia (Spain) in 2015. He is currently a PhD student in the Department of Statistics, Computer Sciences and Mathematics of the Public University of Navarre (Spain). He is a member of the Spatial Statistics research group and he is a researcher in training at the Institute for Advanced Materials (INAMAT). Since 2015 he has worked in different research projects as project assistant, and since 2016 is an associate lecturer in the Department of Statistics, Computer Sciences and Mathematics of the Public University of Navarre (Spain).

His research work is developed in the field of Remote Sensing, proposing new spatio-temporal methods of reconstruction of satellite images or adding complementary information from different data sources, for example, rainfall stations. The results derived from these researches have been published in impact journals and presented in various national and international conferences.
